raw.title: Saras Baug
raw.address: Sr. No. 138 Pai, Sadashiv Peth, Pune
raw.body:
Sarasbaug is a major landmark in the city of Pune in India. The place where the park now stands was once occupied by a small lake. However, the lake dried up and was later developed into Sarasbaug. The whole 25-acre complex is known as Sarasbaug. Sarasbaug is a historic and beautiful spot built in 1750 by Shrimant Nanasaheb Peshwe.  In 1784, Shrimant Madhavrao Peshwe build the famous Talyatil Ganpati temple, dedicated to Lord Siddhi Vinayak. The Ganesh temple in Saras Baug is also known as Talyatla Ganapati (in Marathi: तळ्यातला गणपती ) which translates as the Ganapati of the lake.

Today, Sarasbaug has lovely gardens, fountains, a jogging track, lotus flowers, and a memorial for martyrs. It’s a peaceful place loved by families, tourists, and devotees alike. Visit to enjoy nature, history, and calmness!
raw.key_attractions:
• Artificial Pond: Built by Shrimant Nanasaheb Peshwe in 1750 AD, covering an area of 25 acres, initially used for boating and swimming elephants.
  • Siddhi Vinayak Temple: Established by Shrimant Madhavrao Peshwe in 1784, featuring the deity with a right-turned trunk.
  • Talyatil Ganpati: The temple's unique location surrounded by the pond and garden makes it popular among tourists and devotees.
  • Memorial of Martyrs: A tribute to martyrs located within the area.
  • Navloba Temple: A historic temple included in the attractions.
  • Majestic Fountains: Beautiful, leaping fountains enhance the visual appeal.
  • Grand Meadow: A spacious and picturesque green space.
  • Lotus Flowers in the Pond: Adding natural beauty to the surroundings.
  • Jogging Track: A recreational path for fitness enthusiasts.
raw.timings:
• Morning 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM
  • Evening 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM

raw.title: Peshwe Energy Garden and Adventure Park
raw.address: Sr. No. 138 Pai, Sadashiv Peth, Pune
raw.body: It has been named after the Peshwas who were prime ministers to the kings and owners of the Parvati area. The park is located adjacent to the Sarasbaug garden and in the vicinity of the Parvati temple hill.
raw.key_attractions:
• Adventure Park for Children: Previously the area was part of a lake that was subsequently converted into a garden. The Peshwe Park is now called ‘Peshwe Adventure Park', especially after the induction of 50 types of adventure sports games/activities like net climbing, walk rope climbing, wall climbing, grappling, tower climbing, balancing, high altitude cycling, rope skidding, crossing the pond on a rope, etc. are just name of few (for 3-16 age group).
  • Educational Models: Pune Municipal Corporation has attempted to increase the general awareness regarding the importance and the need of non-conventional sources of energy. Educational models of solar energy, hydel energy and biogas energy projects are presented which provide information about their basic concepts to young minds.
  • Halls of Energy Generation: Educational displays showcasing traditional energy methods.
  • Children's Playground: A fun and safe area for kids to play.
  • Natural Pond: A peaceful pond enhancing the park’s tranquility.
  • Pagoda in the Pond: A picturesque pagoda located in the center of the pond.
  • Phulrani (Flower Garden): A vibrant garden full of colorful flowers.
  • Boating Facility: Offering boating experiences on the pond.
  • Confluence of Sports and Training: A unique blend of recreational sports and educational training activities.
raw.timings:
• Morning 10:00 AM to Afternoon 1:00 PM
  • Afternoon 2:00 PM to Evening 6:00 PM
  • ( Wednesday weekly holiday )

raw.title: Chhatrapati Sambhaji Raje Garden
raw.address: Jangali Maharaj Road, Pune - 411004 (Adjust to Balgandharva Natyagruha)
raw.body:
Chatrapati Sambhajiraje Garden built by Pune Municipal Corporation flaunts the Aquarium of freshwater ornamental fishes, which was set up on 1st Aug 1952. The aquarium at the garden is loved by kids as it serves the educational as well as entertainment purpose for them. A garden is a perfect place for children, young as well as for seniors. It also offers a mini fort & big fountain which attract kids as well as elders. The big fountain located at the centre of the park enhances the beauty of the surroundings with its sparkling showers. The park has also created a special play park which attracts the children around the city.
Exercise lovers enjoy the plenty of space and jogging track at the garden. We find the people resting under the cool shades of tall green trees during the daytime. A variety of colourful flower plants soothes eyes and the lovely fragrance tickles nostrils. The green and a well-maintained garden are watered by a sprinkler system. This system helps to keep the garden green all year around.
raw.key_attractions:
• Aquarium: A small aquarium where all the aquatic world lovers can take the pleasure of watching the variety of fishes. The aquarium mainly appeals to the kids.
  • Rare Trees: Mani Mohar, Rudraksha, Kailaspati, Golden bottle brush, Bhadraksh, Sitaashok , Kanchan are some of the rare trees that are housed in the garden.
  • Statues: Features statues of famous personalities like singer Ramchandra Ganesh Kundgolkar (Sawai Gandharva) and dramatist Ram Ganesh Gadkari.
  • Shivmandir: A temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
  • Fountains: Beautiful fountains add charm to the garden.
  • Pagodas: Recreation spaces with pagodas.
  • Historical Tank: A tank with historical significance.
  • Imaginary Fort: A creatively designed fort structure.
  • Lakshmi Idol: A well-crafted idol of Goddess Lakshmi.
  • Exhibitions: The Pune Municipal Corporation organizes some remarkable exhibitions in the garden every year. The flower exhibition and fort exhibition are the prime attractions during Diwali. At this time, the exhibition showcases the miniatures of various forts. In this exhibition, participants construct the forts by traditional techniques. Best fort is honored by prize.

  • A grand event for environment lovers, drawing around two lakh visitors from across Maharashtra.
raw.timings:
Garden Timings:

  • Morning: 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM
  • Evening: 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM

    Open all 7 days

Aquarium Timings:

  • Morning: 8:00 AM to 11:00 AM
  • Evening: 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM

( Wednesday weekly holiday )

raw.title: Late Yashwantrao Chavan Garden (Seven Wonder Theme Park)
raw.address: Sr. No. 82, Parvati Darshan, Pune.
raw.body:
Established in 1993 and covering an area of 8,000 square meters, the Seven Wonders Park offers a unique opportunity to experience some of the most famous landmarks of the world right in the heart of the city. The park features replicas of iconic structures such as the Taj Mahal, the Great Pyramids of Giza, the Leaning Tower of Pisa, Stonehenge, and the Colosseum, allowing visitors, especially students, to fulfill their curiosity about these global wonders.

The park also provides engaging 3D and 4D shows, offering an immersive experience that brings these wonders to life. For children, there are plenty of playthings and recreational activities to enjoy. With its fascinating blend of education and entertainment, the park is a popular destination for families and tourists alike, offering a fun and informative visit to some of the world's greatest architectural marvels.
raw.key_attractions:
• Replicas of Global Landmarks: Includes the Taj Mahal, Great Pyramids of Giza, Leaning Tower of Pisa, Stonehenge, and the Colosseum.
  • 3D and 4D Shows: Immersive experiences that bring the wonders to life.
  • Playthings for Kids: Fun recreational activities and play areas for children.
  • Educational Value: Offers an informative visit, especially for students curious about world history and architecture.
  • Family-Friendly: A perfect destination for families and tourists to explore and learn about the world's wonders.
raw.timings:
• 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM

raw.title: Lumbini Garden
raw.address: Survey No. 191A, Maharashtra Housing Board, Yerwada, Pune 411006
raw.body:
This garden was established in 2011, this beautifully designed garden draws inspiration from Lumbini, Nepal, the revered birthplace of Gautam Buddha. It offers visitors a tranquil space to reflect and unwind. The park is adorned with life-like depictions of pivotal scenes from Gautam Buddha's life, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in his teachings and journey. Impressive statues, including a grand bronze sculpture, add to the garden's spiritual essence.

For recreation, the garden features a jogging track, a children’s play area, and a serene pavilion (pagoda) that invites quiet moments of contemplation. The serene atmosphere, combined with lush greenery, makes this garden a perfect destination for those seeking peace, inspiration, and a deeper connection to nature.
raw.key_attractions:
• Nice and well-developed garden with ample space for walking, meditation, and exercise.
  • jogging track and pagoda facility is available for citizens.
  • Theme of garden is based on lord Buddha’s life. and on that basic name of garden is given as “LUMBINI GARDEN”
  • There is a fountain in garden which is designing in rose palet shape.
  • There is Different types of Sculpture of Lord Buddha is created in garden which is based on his life.
  • Beautiful surroundings with lush greenery and sculptures depicting the life of Buddha.
  • Different types of trees and shrubs also make garden more beautiful, well maintained shaped trees.
  • Good facilities for children’s including a separate play area with slides and swings, Spinning wheels, duck wheels etc. playing equipments.
  • Well light at night, making it suitable for evening walks.
  • Peaceful atmosphere, ideal for relaxing and spending time with family and friends.
raw.timings:
• 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM

  • 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM

raw.title: Late Sanjay Mahadeo Nimhan Gram Sanskruti Garden
raw.address: S. No. 8, Someshwarwadi, Pashan, Pune
raw.body: To evoke the image of India's rural culture, Village Park near Someshwar Wadi has been constructed. It is a replica of rural India, offering visitors an immersive experience of traditional village life. The park showcases life-size models of a Gram Panchayat, Patil Wada, traditional cattle sheds, and farming tools, capturing the essence of rural culture, agriculture, and heritage. Visitors can enjoy vibrant scenes of bhajan, kirtan, a village school, and wedding ceremonies, alongside models of wild animals in natural habitats. The park's serene environment, complemented by the Someshwar Temple and riverbank, provides a peaceful escape from urban life, making it a must-visit for tourists seeking a glimpse into rural India.
raw.key_attractions:
Village Management Representation -  Its main goal is to give an overall experience of village life including various traditions, customs, festivals and events. The garden depicts structure of village and life cycle of village populace In Maharashtra,12 balutedarand 18 a/utedar mutually complement village management. This characteristic is reflected in garden landscaping with Huge village border (Gaonwesh) and PatilWada, and they are the most attractive places in the garden.

Village Business Representation -  The garden gives experience of village business, life cycle and costumes through 68 different themes. A total of 555 statues including those of blacksmith, barber, cobbler, goldsmith, astrologer, tailor, farmer, carpenter and so on are at the Village Park, and the expressions of these personality statues are created wonderfully.

Traditional farming practices, cowshed and village market are attractively designed and represented. It has a temple where religious programmes are held daily. It also features one of the greatest religious movements of India, the Palkhi. A Panchayat with Tanta Mukti Kendra, where disputes of villagers are solved mutually, is also depicted.
raw.timings:
• Morning 10:00 AM to Evening 8:00 PM

    Open all 7 days

raw.title: Shahid Major Pradeep Tathawade Garden
raw.address: Sr. No. 61/1A/1, Karve Nagar, Pune.
raw.body:
Major Pradeep Tathawade Udyan is a major landmark of Pune. It is developed and maintained by PMC's Garden Department. It was opened to public on October 31, 2002. A life-size statue of Major Pradeep Tathawade, who sacrificed his life fighting for the country with militants in Poonch district of Jammu in June 2000 and after whom the park is named, stands tall at the garden entrance.

Spread over 2.75 acres; it has 260-metre­ The garden includes several water fountains, children's play area and at the centre of the garden, there is an artificial pond with fish in it. A battle tank that was pressed into service during the lndo-Pak war (1971) was gifted to the PMC by the Indian Army. It is placed in the garden for visitors to view.

The visitors from the vicinity of areas like Dhanukar Colony, Bhusari Colony, Paud Road and Sinhagad Road regularly visit this garden. People regularly visit the garden to practice yoga and attend laughter club in the morning and jog in the evenings. Blessed with a lush green lawn, a cluster of trees and comfortable sitting arrangements, it is a haven for relaxation, especially for senior citizens.
raw.key_attractions:
• Stage Facing Lawn: A huge stage facing lawn is available to the citizens.  Many cultural and social activities are organised here, as it has comfortable seating arrangement for citizens.
  • Yoga Centre: A small yoga centre located in the middle of the garden is a treat for yoga enthusiasts, while a small pond with a variety of small fish sets this garden apart from the others. Children can be seen glued to the pond, trying to catch a glimpse of their favourite marine life.
  • Variety of Trees: The park is dotted with mostly indigenous trees like Mango, Neem, Pimpal, Banyan, Amia, Cheery, Almond, Palash, Kanchan, Jamun, Bamboo and Bel are planted here. The garden also has varieties of roses, marigold, Dahlia, Zinnia, Jasmine, Shoeflower, jai-jui and chamak besides many different types of shrubs like bougainvillea.

  • Outside the park

    The garden is maintained by PMC's Garden Department. There are no food stalls outside this garden. Outdoor games and pet animals are not allowed into it.
raw.timings:
• 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM
  • 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM

    Open all 7 days

raw.title: Matoshree Ramai Bhimrao Ambedkar Garden
raw.address: Sr. No. 42-A, In Front of Wadia College, Pune.
raw.body:
Created in 2011 and spanning 10,000 square meters, this park is known for its precise design and well-planned layout. At its heart is a huge fountain that adds an elegant touch to the surroundings. The park is surrounded by dense trees, providing ample shade and a peaceful atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the Yoga Hall, offering a space for relaxation and fitness, while the pagoda adds a beautiful architectural feature.

raw.address: Sr. No. 131, Ishan Nagari, Warje Malwadi, Pune
raw.body:
Prepare to be enchanted by the allure of Dhumal Garden in Pune. Let's explore what makes this park so special and what you can look forward to during your visit. As you step into Dhumal Garden in Warje, you will instantly feel its serenity and understand why it is a beloved spot. Whether you are a resident or a traveler, Dhumal Garden is a must-visit destination in Pune. Visit Dhumal Garden for a Journey Through Tranquility and Recreation Upon entering Dhumal Garden, you will be greeted with a myriad of delightful experiences. Stroll through the park's scenic trails and let the natural surroundings rejuvenate your spirit. The park's lush greenery and vibrant flowers provide a picturesque backdrop for relaxation and exploration.

There's more to enjoy at Dhumal Garden than just its scenery. The park offers various amenities like jogging track,  pagoda designed to enhance your visit.

 Dhumal Garden is renowned for its excellent facilities and dedication to visitor satisfaction. Whether you are a nature lover or simply looking for a peaceful day out, Dhumal Garden promises an unforgettable experience that will leave you longing for more.

When you visit Dhumal Garden, you will realize that it is more than just a park; it is a gateway to the essence of Pune and a testament to its natural splendor. Plan a visit soon to see what makes Dhumal Garden so unique.

Furthermore, Dhumal Garden plays a crucial role in preserving the natural environment and promoting sustainable practices. By visiting, you support these efforts and help ensure that the park remains a sanctuary for future generations. Visiting parks can also improve physical and mental health, as outdoor activities and serene environments keep the body active and the mind refreshed. Additionally, it offers a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, providing a calming and stress-relieving experience.

Dhumal Garden offers a unique blend of relaxation, recreation, and inspiration. It caters to various interests and provides a rewarding experience for people of all ages. So next time you're planning a trip or looking for a fun activity, consider visiting Dhumal Garden and discover the treasures it holds.

Garden theme is based on children's park. So that purpose many of playing equipments like slides, swing, Spinning wheel,  duck wheel spinning etc. are installed Only for children's.

• Scenic Beauty & Tranquility – Lush greenery, vibrant flowers, and serene surroundings for relaxation and exploration.

  • Recreation & Relaxation – Ideal for nature lovers, joggers, and those seeking a peaceful retreat.

raw.title: Lakaki Lake
raw.address: Sr. No. 511/510/501/502, Model Colony, Shivajinagar, Pune
raw.body:
Amidst the hustle and bustle of the city, we found a quiet place where you'd want to be left alone with your thoughts. The Lakaki lake, known to a very few people of the city, is located in Model Colony. There's a walking track along the beautiful lake for those who'd like to run by the lake or enjoy an evening stroll. And from either side of the track, you can see a different view.

The lake, in its current state is an extension of an old natural lake. The development of this lake in its current state was carried out by one of Pune's famous industrial family, the Kirloskars and have named the lake after the founder of the Kirloskar industries, Laxman Kashinath Kirloskar. That's why the lake is called La-Ka-Ki lake.

As this lake park is not known to many people, the place is generally vacant. You will find a few locals on their morning or evening walks. The lake plays a host to a number of birds of different species. You can find storks, bulbuls, ducks, cranes among others, taking a dip into the lake's cool waters.

The walking track around the lake has a number of benches throughout. The best part is that from each bench, you'll view the lake from a different angle. You can take a book and read in peace, find inspiration or simply listen to music as you enjoy the view.
raw.key_attractions:
• Serene Escape – A peaceful retreat amidst the city's hustle and bustle, perfect for solitude and relaxation.
  • Scenic Walking Track – A beautiful lakeside pathway for jogging, walking, or enjoying an evening stroll.
  • Unique Lake History – Named after Laxman Kashinath Kirloskar, developed by the renowned Kirloskar family.
  • Rich Birdlife – Home to diverse bird species like storks, bulbuls, ducks, and cranes.
  • Secluded & Less Crowded – A hidden gem in Pune, offering a tranquil atmosphere away from crowds.
  • Multiple Viewing Angles – Benches placed strategically along the track provide different perspectives of the lake.
  • Perfect for Reading & Reflection – Ideal for book lovers, artists, and those seeking inspiration.
raw.timings:
• Morning 6:00 AM to 10:00 AM
  • Evening 4:00 PM to 7:00 PM

raw.title: Uddan Bio-diversity Park
raw.address: Sr. No. 199, 204, 205, 206 (Part) & 209 (Part), Lohgaon, Viman Nagar, Pune.
raw.body: The Udaan Biodiversity Park, situated in Pune’s Viman Nagar, has been welcoming visitors since 2012. Known as Udaan Jaiv Vividhata Garden, this park was developed through a partnership between the Zensar Foundation (an independent trust under Zensar Technologies, a software and services firm) and the Pune Municipal Corporation. The park was designed to promote biodiversity by transforming barren, rocky terrain into a thriving ecosystem, providing a habitat for diverse species to flourish.

  • Attractive Waterfall

raw.title: Pune Shines in Swachh Survekshan 2024 Rankings!
raw.summary:
Pune Shines in Swachh Survekshan 2024 Rankings!

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has achieved a remarkable feat in the Swachh Survekshan 2024 rankings by securing the 8th position at the national level (in the category of cities with population above 10 lakhs) and 2nd position in Maharashtra. This recognition reflects the collective efforts of PMC officials, staff and citizens toward a cleaner and greener city.

Key Highlights from PMC’s Achievements:

  • Pune received the Water+ and GFC 5-Star Certification.
  • 100% Door-to-Door Garbage Collection across 8.5 lakh+ households and commercial properties using over 900 active vehicles.
  • Source-level segregation is practiced in 984 locations citywide.
  • 16 wet and 14 dry waste processing centers are operational using advanced technologies like composting, biogas, bio-CNG, and RDF.
  • Decentralized composting initiatives promoted in housing societies and communities.
  • Continuous 3-shift sweeping and night-time cleaning to maintain cleanliness across the city.
  • 17 permanent RRR (Reduce, Reuse, Recycle) centers have been established to encourage responsible waste handling.
  • Massive awareness campaigns like Swachhta Abhiyan, and plastic-free initiatives are regularly undertaken.
  • Citizen engagement through schools, colleges, and local groups has significantly contributed to the achievement.

The consistent guidance of the Hon. Municipal Commissioner Shri. Naval Kishore Ram, Additional Commissioners, health and sanitation teams, and active media feedback have played a vital role in improving on-ground implementation.

The contribution of Zonal Deputy Commissioners, Assistant Commissioners, Health Inspectors, Engineers, and Safai Karamcharis has made this achievement possible.

raw.title: Launch of ‘Road Adoption Scheme’ Held Successfully
raw.summary:
Launch of ‘Road Adoption Scheme’ Held Successfully

Date: 16th July 2025

Pune Municipal Corporation launched the ‘Road Adoption Scheme’ on Wednesday, 16th July 2025, by Zone no. 1 Office. The scheme was inaugurated by Hon. Municipal Commissioner Mr. Naval Kishore Ram, in the presence of Additional Commissioners and department heads.

The aim of the scheme is to improve the condition, safety, and cleanliness of city roads. Under this program, PMC officers and social workers/NGOs have been assigned responsibility for specific roads, acting as "guardians".

They will regularly inspect and ensure action is taken on 29 key aspects, including:

  • Walkable, clean footpaths
  • Pothole-free roads
  • Removal of encroachments, flexes, and banners
  • Clearing of hanging internet cables
  • Visibility of zebra crossings
  • Maintenance and painting of dividers
  • Trimming dangerous tree branches
  • Proper alignment of drainage and chambers
  • Regular cleanliness and debris removal

A total of 90 participants – 45 PMC staff and 45 active citizens – have been appointed. All work will be done voluntarily, with local citizen involvement ensuring regular monitoring and faster action on road issues.

The scheme is currently running as a pilot project in selected roads under the three ward offices of zone 1. If successful, it may be expanded citywide.

Hon. Commissioner Mr. Naval Kishore Ram shared his views and stated, “This initiative will ensure better maintenance of city roads with direct public participation. We aim for cleaner and safer roads for all citizens.”

The event was attended by:

  1. Mr. M. J. Pradeep Chandran (Addl. Commissioner – General)
  2. Mr. Omprakash Divte (Addl. Commissioner – Works)
  3. Mr. Aniruddha Pawaskar (Chief Engineer – Roads)
  4. Mr. Sandeep Dhole Patil (Deputy Commissioner – Solid Waste Management)
  5. Mr. Sandeep Khalate (Deputy Commissioner – Encroachment)
  6. Mr. Ballal (Deputy Commissioner – Zone 5)
  7. Mr. Thorat (Deputy Commissioner – Zone 4)

All Assistant Commissioners from respective wards

Citizens who addressed the gathering included Mr. Dnyaneshwar Molak, Dr. Siddharth Dhende, Mrs. Kamal Dhole Patil, Mrs. Shyamala Desai, Mrs. Kanij Sukhrani, Mrs. Vanita Vagaskar, Mrs. Lata Rajguru, and Mrs. Ashwini Landge.

 

The event was organized by Mr. Madhav Jagtap, Deputy Commissioner of Zone 1, and anchored by Mr. Vivek Dev.

raw.title: Special Workshop by Solid Waste Management Department on Food Waste Reduction
raw.summary:
Special Workshop by Solid Waste Management Department on Food Waste Reduction

 

The Solid Waste Management Department of PMC conducted a workshop today in collaboration with WRI India, focused on food waste reduction.

The session brought together key stakeholders from the HoReCa (Hotel, Restaurant, Canteen) sector, including representatives from the National Restaurant Association of India (NRAI) – Pune Chapter, head chefs from leading 5-star hotels, and social organizations such as Robin Hood Army, Vayu, Janwani, Adar Poonawalla Foundation, and SWaCH.

raw.summary:
"Deep Clean Drive" Conducted Successfully Across 15 Ward Offices of PMC

On 1st and 2nd July 2025, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) carried out a comprehensive Deep Clean Drive across its 15 ward offices.

Various departments including Solid Waste Management Department, Sky Sign Department, Encroachment Department, and other allied departments collaborated to carry out extensive cleanliness activities across the city.

This initiative was aimed at enhancing public hygiene and reinforcing collective efforts to keep the city clean.

raw.title: Tree Plantation Festival and “Tree Hospital Van” Inauguration Held by PMC

images.alt: Tree Plantation Festival and “Tree Hospital Van” Inauguration Held by PMC

raw.summary:
On the occasion of World Environment Day, the Garden Department and Tree Authority of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) organized a Tree Plantation Festival and the inauguration of the "Tree Hospital Van". The event aimed to spread awareness about environmental conservation and urban greenery.

The ceremony took place on:

  • Date: Thursday, 5th June 2025
  • Time: 10:30 AM to 11:00 AM
  • Venue: Chhatrapati Sambhaji Raje Garden, Shivajinagar, Pune

PMC officials, environmental activists, and citizens participated in the event and contributed to tree planting activities. The newly launched Tree Hospital Van will serve as a mobile unit to inspect, treat, and preserve trees across Pune city.

This initiative reflects PMC's commitment to promoting sustainable urban ecosystems and encouraging public participation in protecting the environment.

raw.title: Heritage Yatra 2025 – A Celebration of Pune’s Cultural Legacy

images.alt: Heritage Yatra 2025 – A Celebration of Pune’s Cultural Legacy

raw.summary:
On the occasion of the Amrut Mahotsav year of the Pune Municipal Corporation, a cultural heritage festival “Heritage Yatra 2025” will be jointly organized by the Pune Municipal Corporation and M.I.T. A.D.T. University from April 23 to 26, 2025.
To mark the Amrut Mahotsav year and World Heritage Day, the program “Heritage Yatra 2025,” based on the heritage theme, will be held at Kalagram, Pu. La. Deshpande Garden, Sinhagad Road, from April 23 to 26, 2025. The event will be inaugurated at 5:00 PM on April 23, 2025, at the hands of the Hon’ble Municipal Commissioner, Dr. Rajendra B. Bhosale.

Various programs will be organized under “Heritage Yatra 2025.” One of the key highlights will be a cultural performance titled “Agyat Shalaka,” which will highlight the contributions of unknown Indian women warriors who fought for the motherland. This performance will be presented by the Mumbai-based ‘Rangved’ group on April 23, 2025, after the inauguration.

Additionally, from April 23 to 26, multiple competitions and events based on the heritage theme will be held for school and college students. These will include essay competitions, storytelling competitions, debate competitions, and more. Workshops will be conducted on subjects such as theatre, musical theatre, Madhubani art, painting, bamboo craft, and other traditional forms.

A photography competition will also be held for the younger generation, focusing on the architectural frames of old Pune – its doors and windows.

A Heritage Walk from Shaniwarwada to Vishrambaug Wada will have been organized on April 18, 2025, to commemorate World Heritage Day. Another Heritage Walk will be held on April 24, 2025, from 7:00 AM to 10:00 AM.

Overall, this program will provide a grand platform to showcase and experience the rich historical and cultural heritage of Pune. The entire event will be hosted at Kalagram, Pu. La. Deshpande Garden.
Kalagram will stand as a proud creation developed by the Pune Municipal Corporation, and every citizen of Pune will be proud of it. All citizens will be encouraged to visit and participate in this vibrant celebration.

raw.title: Bal Gandharva Ranga Mandir
raw.address: Shivajinagar, Near Rani Jansi Statue,JM Road, Pune
raw.auditorium:
• Auditorium Size: 5159 sq. ft. (Ground Floor)
  • Seating: 669 (Ground) + 320 (Balcony) = 989
  • Stage Area: 2400 sq. ft.
  • Parking Area: 60' x 300' (Total area available for parking).
  • Art Gallery: 3280 sq. ft.
  • Facilities: The theatre offers an air-conditioned auditorium, pay and park facility, a canteen and cafeteria, and tenements for drama companies to store their sets. It also provides display boxes for advertisements, an art gallery for exhibitions of handicrafts, paintings, and works by upcoming artists, as well as lodging and food facilities for artists. VIP rooms are available for special guests.
raw.booking_policy:
• Booking for the auditorium shall be done on a 4 - months slot basis i.e.,
    • January to April
    • May to August
    • September to December
  • All Thursdays, Saturdays, Sundays and government holidays will be considered public holidays.
  • The applicant should apply for these 4-month slots on a printed form prescribed by PMC. However, a printed application with all the relevant information on the letterhead of the Institute or the company is also acceptable. The booking request applications shall be accepted in the theatre office between 10.30 am to 5.30 pm within the stipulated time given below. Forms submitted after the stipulated time shall not be considered.
Sr. No. 4 - Month Slot Period of accepting the form
1 January to April From 15th to 25th November
2 May to August From 15th to 25th March
3 September to December From 15th to 25th July
  • It is mandatory to pay the deposit amount along with the booking form.
  • It is necessary to book the theatre at least 15 days before the actual program date (date of the program included). If the prescribed amount is not deposited with the theatre within the scheduled time then the booking shall be cancelled and right to give away the date to another program shall be with the Hon. Chief Manager, Cultural Centers, Pune Municipal Corporation.
  • To organize an exhibition in the art gallery, an application will have to be made 2 months in advance on the 1st of the month.

Contact: Hon. Administrative Officer, Cultural Centres, PMC
Contact No : 020-25532959
raw.description:
Owned by the Pune Municipal Corporation, Bal Gandharva Ranga Mandir is a sophisticated theatre with an auditorium and exhibition hall. Located in Shivajinagar, Pune, it serves as a cultural hub for various events, including educational, social, religious, and corporate functions.
Key Details:

  • Location: Shivajinagar, Near Rani Jansi Statue, JM Road, Pune.
  • Opening: 26th June 1968, inaugurated by Hon. Yashwantrao Chavan
  • Cornerstone Ceremony : Monday, 8th October 1962
  • Honoured By : Natsamrat Narayanrao Rajhans alias Bal Gandharva (the man himself)
  • Opening Ceremony : Wednesday, 26th June 1968 under the Chairmanship of Hon. Acharya Atre
  • Inaugurated By : Hon. Yashwantrao Chavan, Home Minister of India

raw.description: The Pune Municipal Corporation has built the Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe Smarak behind the statue of Swami Vivekananda in the Bibwewadi area of Pune. This theatre has been named after Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe who was a social reformer, folk poet and writer from Maharashtra. It is available for cultural, educational, social and religious activities, as well as corporate and business seminars.

raw.booking_policy:
• Booking for the auditorium shall be done ona 4 - months slot basis i.e.,
    • January to April
    • May to August
    • September to December
  • This slot-wise booking includes 12.30 pm, 5.00 pm and 9.30 pm time slots for all the months across Thursdays, second and fourth Saturdays, Sundays and all the days of government - declared holidays.
  • The applicant should apply for these 4-month slots on a printed form prescribed by PMC. However, a printed application with all the relevant information on the letter head of the institute or the company is also acceptable. The booking request applications shall be accepted in the theatre office between 10.30 am to 5.30 pm within the stipulated time given below. Forms submitted after the stipulated time shall not be considered.
Sr. No.4-Month SlotPeriod of Accepting the Form
1January to AprilFrom 15th to 25th November
2May to AugustFrom 15th to 25th March
3September to DecemberFrom 15th to 25th July
  • It is mandatory to pay the deposit amount along with the booking form.
  • It is necessary to book the theatre at least 15 days before the actual programme date (date of programme included). If the prescribed amount is not deposited with the theatre within the scheduled time then the booking shall be cancelled and the right to give away the date to another programme shall be with the Hon. Chief Manager, Cultural Centres, Pune Municipal Corporation.

Booking for Odd - Days

  • By Odd-days we mean those Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays when there are no government-declared or public holidays.
  • It is necessary for the applicant of Odd-day bookings to submit their application with the relevant information to the Hon. Chief Manager, Cultural Centres, Pune Municipal Corporation in writing 14 days prior to the programme, by 11.30 am. It is mandatory to pay the deposit amount along with the booking form.
  • The decision regarding the Odd-days booking is given 14 days prior to the programme (the day of the programme included). For example, if the programme is on the 16th then the decision is communicated on the 2nd of that month.
  • Odd-day Booking – It is mandatory for the institute/applicant who gets the booking to deposit the entire rent on the day of the decision i.e., 14 days prior to the programme.
  • If applications do not come in for Odd-day bookings within the stipulated time period and even after action taken as per (3) and (4) there are no bookings then the PMC stands to face a financial loss. In such exceptional situations, that date is assigned to whoever applies for the same before the day of the programme. The applicant needs to pay the required deposit and the rent on the day of the programme itself.
  • Booking of the Art Gallery is done 2 months in advance on the 1st day of the month.

For more details, Contact : Hon. Administrative Officer, Cultural Centres, PMC

Contact No. 9922285555
Note:- Only inquire about the management of the theater. Do not inquire about ticket sales.
raw.description:
Yashwantrao Chavan Nattyagruha  is a theatre auditorium and exhibition hall, which is located in the Kothrud area of Pune. The theatre is named after the former Chief Minister of the State, a great co-operative leader, Yashwantrao Chavan, who was fondly known as the Leader of Common People.Kothrud area of Pune was termed as one of the fastest developing suburbs in Asia in the 1980s and has seen a rapid growth in housing projects.

The auditorium can beused for workshops, discussions, speeches, seminars, as well as enlightening and entertaining cultural, social, educational, and religious programmes. This nattyagruhais widely used for drama and theatre, and brings cultureand art to the residents of Kothrud.

Cornerstone Ceremony :Thursday, 28th October 1986
Honoured By :Hon. Shankarrao Chavan, Former Chief Minister of Maharashtra State
Opening Ceremony :Saturday, 25th November 2000
Inaugurated By :Hon. Vijaysinh Mohite Patil, Minister of PWD, Maharashtra State
Contact :02025395232

Note:- Only inquire about the management of the theater. Do not inquire about ticket sales.

raw.description:
Ganesh Kala Krida Manch situated in the central location of Pune city i.e., Swargate, is the only cultural centre with a capacity of 2,400 seats. Along with the auditorium, it also has two exhibition halls that are made available for the exhibition of garments, handicrafts, Khadi Gramodyog products, jewellery, educational and household products, and technical education, and career guidance programmes.

It is available for cultural, educational, social and religious activities, as well as corporate and business seminars.

Hence, the time slots for this auditorium are as follows:

Morning 9:00 am to 2:00 pm
Afternoon 5:00 pm to 10:00 pm

raw.title: Pandit Bhimsen Joshi Kaladalan, Sahakarnagar.
raw.address: Sahakarnagar Pune
raw.description:
The Pune Municipal Corporation has built the Pandit Bhimsen Joshi Kaladalan in the Sahakarnagar area of Pune city, which houses an Art Gallery, Music Library and Auditorium and also the Mandhre Gallery. The art house was handed over to the Hon. Chief Manager, Cultural Centres on 29th March 2012.

The Pandit Bhimsen Joshi Kaladalan is an air-conditioned theatre with a seating arrangement of 75 on the ground floor. There is a music library to listen to Hindi and Marathi songs where V.I.P. rooms are also available for special guests.

The Art gallery is situated on the first floor of the theatre. The second floor houses the collection of old and rare gramophone records and record players. Also, it displays the art exhibition depicting the life of the great actor from the Marathi film industry Late Chandrakant Mandhre. This theatre has also restored the rare collection of speeches by Mahatma Gandhi, Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru, Subhas Chandra Bose, American President Roosevelt, John F Kennedy, King George V of England, Former President of India Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan and Rabindranath Tagore.

The auditorium can be used only for workshops, discussions, speeches, seminars, and cultural, social, educational, religious as well as enlightening and entertaining programmes.

raw.booking_policy:
Booking Policy

  • Booking for the auditorium shall be done ona 4-months slot basis i.e.,
    • January to April
    • May to August
    • September to December
  • This slot-wise booking includes 12.30 pm, 5.00 pm and 9.30 pm time slots for all the months across Thursdays, second and fourth Saturdays, Sundays and all the days of government-declared holidays.
  • The applicant should apply for these 4-month slots on a printed form prescribed by PMC. However, a printed application with all the relevant information on the letterhead of the institute or the company is also acceptable. The booking request applications shall be accepted in the theatre office between 10.30 am to 5.30 pm within the stipulated time given below. Forms submitted after the stipulated time shall not be considered.
Sr. No.4 - Month SlotPeriod of accepting the form
  1.  
January to AprilFrom 15th to 25th November
  1.  
May to AugustFrom 15th to 25th March
  1.  
September to DecemberFrom 15th to 25th July

 

  • It is mandatory to pay the deposit amount along with the booking form.
  • It is necessary to book the theatre at least 15 days before the actual programme date (date of programme included). If the prescribed amount is not deposited with the theatre within the scheduled time then the booking shall be cancelled and the right to give away the date to another programme shall be with the Hon. Chief Manager, Cultural Centres, Pune Municipal Corporation.

Booking for Odd-days

  • By Odd-days we mean those Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays when there are not government-declared or public holidays.
  • It is necessary for the applicant of Odd-day bookings to submit their application with the relevant information to the Hon. Chief Manager, Cultural Centres, Pune Municipal Corporation in writing 14 days prior to the programme, by 11.30 am. It is mandatory to pay the deposit amount along with the booking form.
  • The decision regarding the Odd-days booking is given 14 days prior to the programme (the day of the programme included). For example, if the programme is on the 16th then the decision is communicated on the 2nd of that month.
  • Odd-day Booking – It is mandatory for the institute/applicant who gets the booking to deposit the entire rent on the day of the decision i.e., 14 days prior to the programme.
  • If applications do not come in for Odd-day bookings within the stipulated time period and even after action taken as per (3) and (4) there are no bookings then the PMC stands to face a financial loss. In such exceptional situations, that date is assigned to whoever applies for the same before the day of the programme. The applicant needs to pay the required deposit and the rent on the day of the programme itself.
  • Booking of the Art Gallery is done 2 months in advance on the 1st day of the month.
raw.description: People residing in the fringe areas had to come to the city to attend various cultural activities. To meet the demands of the citizens from these areas, the Pune Municipal Corporation constructed auditoriums in these fringe areas itself, and Dnyanjyoti Savitribai Phule Smarak is one of them. It is available for cultural, educational, social and religious activities, as well as corporate and business seminars.

raw.address: Saras Baug, Sanas Ground, Pune.
raw.description: The building houses four large auditoriums — two on each floor. On the first floor, the main auditorium displays cartoon sketched by Balasaheb , while another auditorium is an open art gallery for other artists to exhibit their works. The second floor has the capacity to seat around 80 in a closed audio-video theatre. In the other auditorium on the second floor, a unique exhibition of photographs — 'Punawadi to Pune' — showcases the city's journey from its old avatar to the present IT hub it has become.

raw.address: Parvati Darshan, Pune, Maharashtra 411009
raw.description:
Pune Municipal Corporation has constructed the Sahitya Samrat Vijay Tendulkar Sabhagruha within the Rajeev Gandhi E-learning School situated at Parvati Darshan, Pune. It is an air-conditioned hall with a seating capacity of 500 people.

As this hall is within the premises of Rajiv Gandhi E-learning school, and is made available only for school programmes and that too after school timings or on school holidays. It is not available for dramas or any cultural programmes.
raw.other_details: Note: This hall has not been built with the view of staging dramas. It has been built only keeping in view the school-related educational programmes. For example, for annual day celebrations, felicitation ceremony of teachers and students, elocution competitions, lectures etc. It is expected that the daily routine of the school being conducted in this premises shall not be disturbed in any manner.

raw.title: Sahitya Ratna Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe Cultural Arts Temple, Yerawada.
raw.address: 5, Airport Rd, White House Society, Mother Teresa Nagar, Blue Hill Society, Yerawada, Pune, Maharashtra 411006
raw.booking_policy:
Quarterly Reservations

Reservations are made for four months at a time, as per the following schedule:

  1. January to April: Apply between November 15–25.
  2. May to August: Apply between March 15–25.
  3. September to December: Apply between July 15–25.

Applications must be submitted using the official form or on the organization's letterhead. Applications submitted after the deadline will not be considered.

Weekday Reservations (Non-Holidays)

Applications for weekday reservations must be submitted in writing 14 days before the event date, along with the required security deposit.
raw.description:
Pune Municipal Corporation has newly constructed the Sahityaratna Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe Cultural Auditorium in Yerawada.

The auditorium has a seating capacity of 650 and is operated in the same way as Bal Gandharva Rangmandir, which is also managed by Pune Municipal Corporation.

The venue offers facilities such as makeup rooms for artists, spacious parking, a VIP room, and more. The demand for booking this auditorium for events is steadily increasing.

images.alt: Sahitya Ratna Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe Cultural Arts Temple

Reservation Policy
  1. The auditorium is reserved quarterly:
    • January to April
    • May to August
    • September to December
  2. Applications must be submitted within the specified timeframes:
    • January to April: November 15–25
    • May to August: March 15–25

raw.description:
Vitthal Tupe Patil Auditorium, Hadapsar
On behalf of the Pune Municipal Corporation, a new "Vitthal Tupe Patil Auditorium" has been constructed at Hadapsar. The inauguration ceremony of this auditorium was held on Saturday, September 7, 2024, at the hands of Maharashtra State's Deputy Chief Minister and Guardian Minister of Pune District, Honorable Mr. Ajit Dada Pawar, in the esteemed presence of Honorable Mr. Muralidhar Mohol, Union Minister of State for Civil Aviation and Cooperation, Government of India.

The auditorium has a seating capacity of 837 with facilities like a grand 90 x 45 stage, 10 green rooms, guest rooms, an art gallery, 4 small halls, a cafeteria, ample parking space, ticket reservation counters, a CCTV control room, a spacious administrative office, and a beautiful garden.

Purpose:
"Vitthal Tupe Patil Auditorium" is available for hosting cultural, social, religious, and educational events, along with workshops, discussions, speeches, and seminars on various topics.

raw.address: Bremen Chowk, Aundh
raw.booking_policy:
• The auditorium is reserved in four slots every year:
    • January to April
    • May to August
    • September to December
  • Programs can be organized every Monday to Wednesday and Friday at 12:30 PM, 5:00 PM, and 9:30 PM. All Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays are considered government holidays.
  • Applicants must submit the prescribed form from the municipal corporation or on the company/institution letterhead for organizing programs within these four-month slots. Applications will be accepted at the auditorium office from 10:30 AM to 5:30 PM during the specified period. Applications submitted after the deadline will not be accepted.

Slot

Application Acceptance Period

  • January to April - 15th November to 25th November
  • May to August - 15th March to 25th March
  • September to December - 15th July to 25th July

Security deposit submission is mandatory along with the reservation application.

It is mandatory to reserve the auditorium at least 15 days before the scheduled date of the program. Failure to deposit the security deposit in time will result in automatic cancellation of the application. The Cultural Centre Department reserves the right to allow the auditorium for other programs in such cases.

Reservation for Other Days
  • Other days refer to Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday when not public holidays.
  • For these days, applications must be submitted in the name of the Chief Manager of the Cultural Centre Department at least 14 days before the event, by 11:30 AM. Security deposit submission is also mandatory.
  • Applicants will be informed about the approval 14 days prior to the event. It is mandatory for interested institutions/companies to pay the full rent on the same day.
  • If no applications are received 14 days before the event, PMC may suffer financial losses. In such cases, applications submitted the day before the event will also be accepted. Applicants must pay the rent and deposit on the day of the program.
  • For organizing exhibitions in the art gallery, reservations must be made at least 2 months in advance.

raw.title: 100 Resilient Cities (100RC)
raw.summary:
Pune is now part of 100 Resilient Cities (100RC), pioneered by

The Rockefeller Foundation

In May 2016, Pune has been selected among 100 Resilient Cities worldwide. We are now an integral member of the leading community of pioneers, innovators, and highly esteemed cities ready to build urban resilience across the globe.100 Resilient Cities (100RC) was created by the Rockefeller Foundation on the foundation’s Centennial in 2013.

Hundreds of cities across the world had applied to the 100 Resilient Cities Challenge. Among these hundreds of cities, Pune’s innovative approach to urban resilience and its commitment to a collaborative partnership and 100 Resilient Cities was deemed exceptional. And thus, Pune has been selected as one of the 100 Resilient Cities. There are total four cities from India which are part of the 100RC, namely, Pune, Surat, Chennai and Jaipur.

The City is eligible to receive the following support from 100RC:

  1. Funding to the City to retain a Chief Resilience Officer (CRO) for no less than two years.
  2. Technical and capacity-building services and support for the development and execution of a Resilience Strategy for the City in cooperation with the community, various stakeholders, and municipal officials.
  3. Inclusion in a 100RC peer-to-peer and learning network among member cities, creating opportunities for professional development, shared experiences and best practices, and exchange of innovative Resilience Strategies among CROs and other city officials
  4. Access to the 100RC Platform of Partners, providing resources to enable implementation of Resilience Strategies and resilience-related initiatives, including finance, technology, infrastructure and land use, building and design, communications, community engagement, and many more.

(For more information, visit: www.100ResilientCities.org

For more information, contact,

Mr. Mahesh Harhare, Chief Resilience Officer (CRO)

puneresilient@gmail.com

Mr. Ganesh Sonune,

Disaster Management Officer, PMC

raw.title: Citizen Services
raw.summary:
The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has developed the Right to Service (RTS) Portal for the benefit of Pune citizens. Through this portal, citizens can conveniently access essential services online, such as birth certificates, death certificates, marriage registration certificates, fire NOC (No Objection Certificate), and tree cutting permissions, from the comfort of their homes.

Right to Service Portal
Shahari Gareeb Yojana Portal

The Shahari Gareeb Yojana (Urban Poor Scheme) is also now available in digital form. This scheme provides financial assistance for medical needs to eligible families. The digital platform ensures transparency in the application process, real-time online tracking, and speedy disbursal of funds.

Through the DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer) Portal, PMC transfers the benefits of various schemes directly to the Aadhaar-linked bank accounts of the beneficiaries. In the previous financial year alone, 1.25 lakh applications were processed, and ₹6544 crores were disbursed. For more information on the DBT portal, please visit the official website.

DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer) Portal
PMC CARE Portal

PMC CARE (Citizen Assistance Response Engagement Platform) is an integrated platform developed for citizens. Through PMC CARE, citizens can avail services such as property tax NOC, water bill payments, grievance registration, and participation in community initiatives. More than 17 million interactions have been recorded through PMC CARE so far.

PMC has also launched a Whatsapp Chatbot Helpline (8888251001) to provide instant information to citizens about various government schemes and services.

Whatsapp Chatbot

To reach a wider audience and engage more effectively, PMC actively uses social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube. These platforms are used to share updates on policies, new projects, and schemes, as well as to gather feedback from citizens.

PMC has developed www.pmc.gov.in, an informative and service-rich website. This portal provides departmental information, service applications, and downloadable forms.

raw.title: Financial Initiatives
raw.summary:
Financial Assistance:

An amount of Rs. 22,500 is provided from the Pune Municipal Corporation Worker's Welfare Fund and Rs. 52,500 from the Pune Municipal Corporation's general fund, totaling Rs. 75,000 as financial assistance to the legal heirs of employees who passed away while in service..

Documents required:

  • The application in the prescribed format (within 1 year from the death of the employee)
  • Original copy of the Death Certificate of the employee
  • Payment slip
  • Xerox copy of ration card
  • Affidavit from the heirs (If required)
  • Bank Passbook Xerox

Computer Loan:

A computer loan of Rs. 25,000/- is provided to Class 3 & 4 employees of PMC with an interest of 3%.  Mandatory length of service is between 5 to 15 years and the Chief Labour Officer gives the final approval. 

Documents required:

  • Application in the prescribed format.
  • Payment Slip
  • Recommendation of concerned HOD
  • Estimate of computer

Provident Fund

  • ​Upon retirement after completing their service, an employee is granted the Provident Fund with the approval of the Labor Welfare Department.
  • If an employee has not nominated a successor during their service, then after their demise, the Provident Fund amount is disbursed to their heir upon obtaining an indemnity bond.

Workmen's Compensation

​If an employee encounters an accident resulting in disability or death while on duty, compensation is provided to them or their heirs in accordance with Municipal Service Regulation No. 133 and the Workmen's Compensation Act of 1923. The compensation amount is determined based on the provisions outlined in the Workmen's Compensation Act of 1923.

raw.title: Fire Brigade Museum
raw.summary:
Pune is ornamented with several museums that celebrate history and miniatures among other things. Adding to this valuable centres, a first of its kind fire and rescue museum — Late Keshavrao Narayanrao Jagtap Fire Brigade Museum was inaugurated on the 18th of December 2016. The carefully curated collection boasts of the Rolls-Royce Vintage Dennis fire brigade used in 1961 Panshet Dam burst rescue operations.

People usually do not realise the importance of fire brigades and fire men. This museum is meant to increase an awareness about them, the old and new equipment, the techniques used in a fire disaster and so on. The museum is spread over the ground and first floor. The ground floor has a 1956 vintage fire engine, which cost about Rs. 88,000 back then. On the first floor, one will find all the equipment used in fire management, like different suits, wireless sets, rescue belts, monitors to spray water (which are mounted on the fire engine), emergency lights, special cameras which let you see through the smoke and more.

The museum has made cut-outs of faceless fire men. One can just place one’s face on a cut-out and get a picture clicked. Another attraction at the museum is a Ganapati made of waste equipment. In a corner is a water body with a boat floating in it, highlighting how fire men are also trained to rescue in floods.

There are also display panels with pictures and information put up for people to read about how a fire brigade works. PMC has also set up a stage to show people how a fire can take place, what the fire brigade does and how should one protect oneself in case of such calamity. Going forward, they are planning to have a three-minute live model show for the same.

The museum has around 100 antique fire equipment that were used in various rescue operations, and a hall which will be used for staff training and film shows regarding the functioning of the fire brigade.

raw.title: Fire Safe Buildings
raw.summary:
Fire Safe Buildings

Multi-story buildings are often at a higher risk of fire. However, fires can be prevented. The following preventive safety measures should be taken:

Do the following:

  • Get complete information about the building's design, exit routes, stairways, emergency exits, and fire alarm locations.
  • Learn how to handle firefighting equipment available on each floor and teach security personnel as well. Also, provide training to use the required technology for extinguishing fires.
  • Ensure that firefighting equipment is in good condition and ready for use.
  • Perform regular emergency drills to ensure you know how to evacuate.
  • Even if the fire is small, immediately call the fire department.
  • Consult the fire department for safety-related advice.
  • Provide the fire department with information about the location and size of the fire, and any trapped individuals.

Do not do the following:

  • Avoid obstruction in the building's courtyard. Do not store any items in the courtyard. Open spaces are necessary to keep firefighting equipment during emergencies.
  • Ensure that no obstacles block the access route or staircase. Emergency routes must remain clear.
  • Do not keep fire doors open on staircases. In an emergency, smoke or heat may enter the stairway, making it difficult for people to escape.
  • Never use the lift during an emergency evacuation.
  • Do not use spaces with electric meters for storage, garbage, or for staff to live in. Such areas are highly risky in case of fire.
  • Do not store flammable materials in the balcony during Diwali. Also, do not dry clothes outside the house during this time.
  • Firecrackers cause many unfortunate incidents.
  • Do not use the basement without permission. Due to a lack of oxygen, it can pose a threat to people's lives.
  • Keep electronic ducts closed to prevent the spread of fire.
  • Ensure AC ducts do not carry smoke or heat from one floor to another. The heat and smoke can spread to other parts of the building through these ducts.
  • Do not paint fire detectors or sprinkler heads. This can make them ineffective.
  • Do not use wood for design purposes in common corridors. It increases the risk of fire.
  • Never disable the fire/smoke detection system. This can make it difficult to get alerts in case of a fire.
  • After a fire breaks out, do not turn off the building's electricity. This can also stop fire safety and firefighting systems.
  • Always consult the fire department before making any changes to the building.

raw.title: Fire Safety for Adults
raw.summary:
Fire Safety Tips for Adults

Kitchen Safety

  • Always stay alert while cooking. Distraction can lead to a fire in the kitchen.
  • Ensure that your clothes do not come in contact with fire.
  • Towels, wooden spoons, and food packaging can catch fire quickly. Keep these items away from stoves and flames.
  • Keep hot pans, matchsticks, and lighters away from children.
  • Keep young children away from the kitchen. Educate older children about cooking safety.

Protection from Heat:

  • Do not place hot food or liquids on the edge of tables or counters.
  • Avoid holding small children while cooking.
  • Check the water temperature before bathing young children.
  • Keep children away from hot water or heaters.

Electrical Equipment Safety:

  • Use electrical sockets carefully. Overloading sockets can cause overheating and fire.
  • Never handle electrical appliances with wet clothes or shoes.
  • Remember to switch off appliances like irons, toasters, and heaters after use.
  • Repair damaged electrical wires immediately.

Flame Safety:

  • Keep burning candles, mosquito coils, and lamps away from children. Also, ensure that they do not come in contact with furniture, curtains, or other flammable objects.
  • Use an ashtray to extinguish cigarettes. Do not throw cigarettes into trash bins.

Firecracker Safety:

  • Wear cotton clothes when lighting firecrackers.
  • Guide children properly while handling firecrackers.
  • Never attempt to relight a firecracker once it fails to light.
  • Light firecrackers in open areas away from houses and trees.
  • While lighting firecrackers, keep a bucket of soil nearby for safety in case of fire.

After a Fire:

  • Plan with your family on how to escape in case of a fire. Identify safe areas outside the home.
  • Keep emergency numbers like the fire department (101) and ambulance (108) in mind.

raw.title: Fire Safety for Children
raw.summary:
Tips for Fire Safety for Children

Prevention from Fire and Burns

  • Stay away from hot pots or objects.
    Keep a safe distance from boiling water and hot oil.
    Check the temperature of hot liquids before drinking them.
    Stay away from gas stoves or fireplaces.

Care to Take with Electronic Devices:

  • Do not use electronic devices without asking your parents.
    Do not handle electronic devices if your clothes or shoes are wet.
    If you find any wires or cords burning, immediately inform your parents.
    Do not insert your fingers, toys, or any other objects into electrical sockets.

Firecracker Safety:

  • Use a long wick to light firecrackers.
  • Light firecrackers at a distance of at least one arm's length.
  • Do not light firecrackers without an adult around.
  • Wear fire-resistant cotton clothes when lighting firecrackers.
  • If a firecracker does not light, do not approach it again.
  • Light firecrackers in open fields away from houses and trees.
  • Keep a bucket of sand with you while lighting firecrackers. It can be used to put out any fire.

Fire Safety:

  • Keep burning candles or lamps away from furniture, beds, curtains, carpets, and other objects.
  • Stay away from matchsticks and lighters.
  • Extinguish candles and lamps before going to bed.

What to Do if There’s a Fire:

  • Once you exit a burning house, do not go back inside.
  • If you cannot see due to smoke, crawl and quickly exit the house.
  • If you are inside a burning building, use stairs instead of the elevator to exit.
  • Remember the contact numbers of Pune Fire Department (101) and Ambulance (108).

raw.title: Grant for purchase of Sports Material
raw.summary:
In accordance with the policy of the Government of Maharashtra, grants are provided to approved government and private sports institutions under the District Sports Officer for the purchase of sports equipment, construction of gyms, and upgrading existing gyms, aiming to promote the daily practice, sports competitions, training, and instil a love for sports among students in Pune city. The grant amount provided to these institutions will be decided with the approval of the Sports Committee. Furthermore, the decision of which institution is eligible or the selection of the institution will remain solely with the Sports Committee. According to the prevailing policy of Pune Municipal Corporation, the decision to grant funds will depend on the financial condition of the concerned institution.

A provision of Rs. 1,50,00,000/- has been made for the financial year 2024-2025.

  • Among this, Rs. 35,00,000/- each has been allocated to the Late Abhijeet Patangrao Kadam Multi-Purpose Sports Complex (Dhanakwadi) and Dr A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Sports Complex (Katraj), totalling Rs. 70,00,000/-.
  • Rs. 30,00,000/- has been allocated for Loknete Gopinath Munde Gymnasium (Kondhwa).
  • The remaining Rs. 50,00,000/- has been reserved for sports nursery equipment.

raw.title: Heatstroke: Causes, Precautions and Guidelines
raw.summary:
Heatstroke: Causes, Precautions and Guidelines

The heatwave has been affecting the whole city since last few days. Every citizen is advised to protect themselves in the blazing summer as prolonged exposure to higher temperatures cause heatstroke.  The health department of Pune Municipal Corporation has issued the advisory to all the citizens

Causes of heat stroke

  • Working outdoors such as farm or on-site during summer
  • Working in factory boiler room, glass factory
  • Working in a high-temperature room
  • Wearing tight clothes
  • Direct or indirect contact such heatwave conditions or continuous rise in the temperature causes heatstroke

Symptoms

  • Tiredness, fever, dry skin
  • Lack of appetite, dizziness, Nausea, headache
  • Hypertension, anxiety, unconsciousness etc.

Treatment

  • Place the affected person in ventilated or an air-conditioned room. If  AC is not available, put on air cooler or Fan around the patient
  • Try to reduce the temperature of patient's body
  • Apply ice packs or put cool wet sheets on the patient's forehead
  • Give a bath to the person with cool water
  • Give a saline if required.

Dos

  • Keep yourself hydrated. Drink water even if you are not thirsty
  • Wear Lightweight cotton clothes
  • Use Sunglasses, umbrellas, hats, shoes and slippers while going outside a home in the afternoon
  • Keep a water bottle while travelling
  • People who work under the sun should use sunglasses or umbrellas and cover their head, neck, and face with wet clothes
  • Regularly drink ORS, homemade lassi, lemon-water, buttermilk etc to maintain the water level in the body
  • Anaemia, obesity, headache, continuous sweating are the symptoms of heatstroke. Consult your doctor immediately if you feel dizziness.
  • Keep the cattle in camps and give them enough water to drink
  • Keep the house cool. For this, use the curtains, shutters and sunshades, as well as take bath with cold water regularly.  
  • Arrange drinking water beside your desk at your workplace
  • Suggest field workers to avoid contact with Sunlight directly
  • Complete your maximum work in the early morning time
  • Take a break for rest in regular intervals while working outdoor
  • Pregnant women workers and sick workers should take more care of themselves
  • Build sheds for protection from the sun on the roadside
  • Create public facilities of drinking water

Dont's

  • Do not keep Children or pets in closed or parked vehicles
  • Avoid going out in the sun during the afternoon from 12.00 to 3.30
  • Avoid wearing dark, thick and tight clothes
  • If the temperature outside is higher, then avoid any physical work
  • Avoid cooking in the afternoon, keep doors and windows of the kitchen open for ventilation while cooking

raw.title: Late Baburao Sanas Ground
raw.summary:
Pune Municipal Corporation developed Late Baburao Sanas Ground in the year 2006. The international modern athletic track with dimensions 8 x 400m has been created at the stadium. Competitions in various categories such as 100m, 400m, 800m running and obstacle racing competitions are organized. Two Plots for the long jump have been created on the ground and competition for the same are organised here. Separate arrangements have been made for shot put, hammer throw and discus throw. There is an independent plot for the Long Jump game, and top jumping mats are made available for the tournament.

Asian Grandpix Tournaments were organized twice before at the Stadium. Every day around 500-600 athletes practice various games at the Late Baburao Sanas Ground. At this venue, international players like Lalita Babar, and  Bhagyashree Shirke have practised their game.

Hostel Facility  

A hostel Facility for outstation players coming to Pune for various sports tournaments is made available at Late Baburao Sanas Ground Campus. The rooms at the hostel are made available for lodging at nominal rates (including per day/per person Rs.560 with taxes). There are a total of 80 rooms and 2 dormitories in the hostel building. The hostel facility is available to outstation players during the tournament period.

All hostel rooms are equipped with enough lighting facility in each room as well as 24-hour water, toilet bathroom and 3 bunk beds. In future, facilities such as 24-hour hot water, television sets in every room and internet, and solar systems will be provided to athletes.

Sports Museum and Sports Information Center

Pune Municipal Corporation aims to set up a Sports Museum and Sports Information Center on the premises of Late Baburao Sanas ground. This museum will provide information about various sports and sports persons to the athletes in Pune and outside.

Rules for usage of playground

  1. The resolution has been passed by the Standing Committee regarding the usage policy for the Playground, Badminton hall and Hostel Rooms at Late Baburao Sanas Ground. 
  2. Baburao Sanas Ground Rules 2013 are followed while renting out the playground and athletic track. 
  3. Government institutions, Government sports institutes, Government schools and colleges will get priority while renting out the Synthetic track of 400 meters at Late Baburao Sanas Ground

raw.title: Legal Activities
raw.summary:
Implementation of various Labour Laws:

  • Legal opinions are provided regarding industrial and labour laws applicable to the employees of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC).
  • To establish industrial peace by maintaining coordination between the employer and the employees concerning various labour laws applicable to the employees of PMC.
  • For various development and maintenance works of the PMC, services of workers are taken through contractors. This office ensures that all such works are carried out in accordance with the rules and regulations of labour and industrial laws.
  • To inspect whether the contractual workers are being paid minimum wages as per the provisions of the Minimum Wages Act, 1948.

Heir Cases as per Hon. Lad / Page Committee Recommendations and Cases under Compassionate Grounds:

As per the recommendations of the Hon. Lad and Page Committee, it is recommended to appoint the heirs of sanitation workers in service after their retirement / death / medical incapacitation / voluntary retirement. All such appointment cases are scrutinised and recommended by this department. Similarly, cases of compassionate appointments of heirs of employees who have passed away during service are also scrutinised and recommended.

MMC Act Section 60 A:

As per Section 60 (A) of the Maharashtra Municipal Corporation Act, the process of updating information of all departments of Pune Municipal Corporation is carried out by this office. Accordingly, an office circular is issued every three months by the Labour Welfare Department, instructing all departments to update their information. All departments then prepare their information and publish it on the PMC website.

RTI Act 2005 Section 4:

Under this section, various information specified under the Act is prepared and published on the website, and it is ensured that all departments of the PMC act accordingly, with periodic reviews being conducted.

raw.title: LPG Safety
raw.summary:
Fire = Fuel + Heat + Oxygen

The combustion process involves the following elements:

  • When all three elements come together, fire ignites. If any one element is removed, fire can be prevented.
  • Combustible material or fuel
  • Oxygen obtained from air or other sources
  • Fire is created when a mixture of these two substances reaches a specific temperature.

LPG Safety Tips:

  • Regularly check the rubber tube. If any defects are found, replace the rubber tube.
  • Light the matchstick first, then turn on the stove knob.
  • If there is a gas leak - do not turn on any electrical appliances, matches, lighters, or light the stove.
  • Before taking a cylinder, make sure there is no gas leakage. Always keep the cylinder upright.
  • If leakage is detected in the cylinder, immediately put on the safety cap. If there is no safety cap, apply soap on the leak and place the cylinder in an open area, then contact the distributor immediately.

In case of fire:

  • Do not panic.
  • Do not run around.
  • Do not take shelter in the bathroom.
  • Contact the fire department.
  • Close the doors behind you when leaving.
  • Try to go to the ground floor instead of the terrace.
  • Do not use the lift to exit.
  • If possible, use fire extinguishing equipment to put out the fire.
  • If you know about any equipment, inform the fire department personnel.

How to contact the fire department:

  • The officer at the control room will pick up your call.
  • Provide them with your address, details of the incident, and your phone number.
  • After hanging up, wait for a return call from the control room.
  • Wait for the fire department personnel and cooperate with them

raw.title: Mock Drills and Evacuation
raw.summary:
Workshops (mock drills) related to fire safety are organized by government/non-government organizations, schools, colleges, shopping malls, five-star hotels, and industrial areas. During these mock drills, participants are trained and guided on how to use fire-fighting equipment and what precautions to take in case of an emergency.

During the mock drill, the following training is provided:

  • Measures to be taken after a fire breaks out.
  • Preventive measures while the fire extinguishing process is ongoing.
  • Evacuation from a burning building.
  • Assisting victims.
  • Using soil, mud, water, and wet cloths to control the fire.
  • Participants are trained on how to protect themselves from fire, contact the nearest hospital for medical treatment, and properly use fire-fighting equipment.
  • The public generally responds positively to these workshops. After the mock drill, any doubts or questions from citizens are addressed.

Fire Drill and Evacuation Guidelines in Case of Fire:

If a fire is detected:

  • Break the glass around the nearest ""push button"" and press the button.
  • Use fire safety equipment available on the floor. Seek help from the building's warden.
  • If instructed by the warden, immediately evacuate the floor.

In case of an evacuation instruction:

  • Use the north or south staircases to quickly evacuate the floor.
  • Avoid using the elevator.
  • Do not enter the storeroom.
  • Do not shout or run in different directions.
  • Do not collect personal belongings.
  • Close the lift lobby and staircase doors.

raw.title: Office Administration
raw.summary:
PMC has adopted an e-Office system to streamline internal workflows, reduce paperwork, and improve decision-making speed. This system enables digital documentation, approval tracking, and inter-departmental collaboration, ensuring greater efficiency and transparency in municipal administration. Additionally, PMC plans to implement SPARROW (Smart Performance Appraisal Report Recording Online Window), a digital system for employee performance appraisals, ensuring timely and transparent evaluations within the municipal corporation.

To further enhance document management, PMC will incorporate e-Sign technology, allowing officials to digitally sign and approve documents securely. This eliminates the need for physical signatures, accelerating approvals and fostering paperless governance.

PMC has also implemented the SAP-ERP system, which integrates financial management, procurement, inventory tracking, and document management into a single platform. The ERP system streamlines vendor payments, budgetary control, and asset tracking while improving efficiency across departments.

raw.title: PMC Care
raw.summary:
PMC Citizen Assistance Response Engagement (PMC CARE)

PMC CARE is an important initiative by the Pune Municipal Corporation, developed with the objective of providing all essential services to citizens in a convenient and transparent manner through a single portal.

For the citizens of Pune and PMC officials, the PMC CARE mobile app and web portal have been developed by the Information and Technology Department as a digital platform. Through this platform, various services are made available, such as expressing opinions on online forums, writing blogs, participating in competitions, paying property tax, applying for birth and death certificates, paying water bills, filing NOCs and tracking complaints, sending important notifications to citizens, providing emergency contact numbers, locating nearby essential services, and more.

So far, the platform has enabled the exchange of information with citizens through 784 blogs, 358 events, 43 webinars, 14 competitions, and 24 groups. Additionally, the platform has facilitated 23,268 property tax transactions, issued 12,115 birth certificates and 3,371 death certificates, and successfully resolved 1,713 complaints.

Through app usage, website visits, and diverse interactions on social media, more than 17 million (1.7 crore) digital engagements have taken place. This multifaceted platform not only provides services but also acts as a central hub for information exchange and citizen interaction.

raw.title: Rewards and Recognition
raw.summary:
Gunwant Kamgar Puraskar:

Every year 20 employees (1 employee from class I & II each, 5 employees from class III and 13 employees belonging to class IV) are facilitated by awarding the ‘Gunwant Kamgar Puraskar’ which consists of a cheque worth Rs. 25,000/-, shawl, memento and a certificate of merit. Maharastra Labour Welfare Board has prescribed certain norms for this award, and the employees are assessed accordingly. Funds for these programs are taken out of the Labour Welfare Fund.

Documents required:

  • Written application
  • Payment slip for the month of April
  • Other documents related to the service

Honour programme for retired employees:

A felicitation programme is arranged every month end for the employees of PMC. The employees are felicitated with shawl & memento.
