raw.title: Special Initiatives for Students of Pune Municipal Corporation-Run Secondary Schools
raw.summary:
Special Initiatives for Students of Pune Municipal Corporation-Run Secondary Schools

  • Free Textbooks:
    Textbooks are purchased from Balbharati Institute and distributed to students of Pune Municipal Corporation-run secondary schools, as well as to students of night schools (Grades 9 and 10) within PMC limits.
  • Free Uniforms:
    Students in PMC-run secondary schools receive two free uniforms each. The cost of these uniforms is directly credited to the students’/parents’ bank accounts under the DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer) scheme.
  • Free Bus Pass Service:
    For students from Grade 5 to Grade 10 residing within PMC limits, 75% of the cost of bus passes is borne by PMC (students pay 25%). For students of PMC-run secondary schools, PMC pays 100% of the bus pass cost directly to PMPML.
  • Free Set of 21 Expected Question Papers:
    Grade 10 students in PMC-run secondary schools receive a set of 21 expected question papers free of cost. The amount is transferred to the students’/parents’ bank accounts through the DBT scheme.
  • Sharadabai Pawar Scholarship Scheme:
    Students of Grade 10 and 12 in PMC-run secondary schools who score above 85% and 80% respectively in the board exams are awarded a scholarship of ₹51,000 each under this scheme.
  • Sanitary Napkins:
    Free sanitary napkins are provided to girls aged 11 to 19 in PMC-run primary and secondary schools by the Solid Waste Management Department of PMC.
  • Snacks Distribution:
    On national holidays such as August 15 (Independence Day) and January 26 (Republic Day), snacks are distributed to all students of PMC-run secondary schools.
  • Educational Excursions:
    Educational trips are organized for students of Grades 9 and 10 in PMC-run secondary schools within the PMC limits.
  • Free Answer Sheets:
    All students of PMC-run secondary schools are provided with free answer sheets.
  • SSC and HSC Board Exam Fees:
    The SSC (Grade 10) and HSC (Grade 12) board exam fees for students in PMC-run secondary schools are paid by the Pune Municipal Corporation.

raw.title: Tree Replacement & Plantation Initiative
raw.summary:
PMC Road Department’s Tree Replacement & Plantation Initiative

As part of the road widening projects undertaken by the Pune Municipal Corporation’s (PMC) Road Department, trees that obstruct the widening process need to be removed. In accordance with regulations, these trees are replaced by planting new native species in the local area.

Many citizens and NGOs believe that planting more native trees in the area can significantly benefit the city's environment, and help transform Pune into a truly green city in the coming years. Several housing societies have also expressed willingness to maintain these trees if they are planted within their premises.

Accordingly, under this initiative, PMC’s Road Department will plant approximately 5-6 feet tall native species of trees in designated spaces along city roads as well as within private housing societies. All such trees will also be geo-tagged. The trees must be maintained carefully, and a biannual maintenance report must be submitted regularly for at least 7 years.

Trees planted along public roads will be maintained by the PMC Road Department, whereas trees planted in private housing societies will be the responsibility of the respective society.

Conditions for Participating in this Initiative:

  1. Preference will be given to housing societies/institutions that currently have space to plant at least 30 trees and allow them sufficient space to grow.
  2. Only property owners, society chairpersons, secretaries, or original apartment owners/property managers will be eligible to participate. Contact details of tenants, gardeners, watchmen, or security personnel should not be provided.
  3. The responsibility for maintaining the planted trees will lie with the person submitting the letter of undertaking (sample attached with the Google Form link ). Participants must ensure the health of the trees and submit a biannual maintenance report for a minimum of 7 years.
  4. A dedicated WhatsApp group will be created for all participating societies/institutions. All communication, including suggestions and feedback, must be shared within this group.
  5. Trees must be planted in open soil within bungalows, societies, educational institutions, or vacant land within the PMC limits. Under no circumstances should trees be planted in balconies, terraces, or large pots.

Current Focus Area: North Main Road

The Road Department is currently undertaking a road widening project on North Main Road. A total of 108 trees are planned for removal, and approximately 2,600 new trees are to be planted as replacements.

To participate in this North Main Road initiative, please click the Google Form link and submit your application.

Google Form Link - https://forms.gle/LvRuzbAoruM2x5icA
The last date to fill the form is May 15, 2025.

raw.title: Urban Poor Health Scheme
raw.summary:
Citizens living in jurisdiction of Pune Municipal Corporation, who are willing to take membership of Urban Poor scheme are supposed to fill the Urban Poor Health Scheme form from Health Department, PMC and submit the attested xerox copy of one document out of following three documents :-

  1. For current financial year, Income Certificate up to 1 lacks from Tahsildar Office OR Xerox copy of Below Poverty Line, Yellow Ration Card OR Citizens living in slum area having slum rehabilitation department, PMC- service tax receipt
  2. Along with above mentioned one document out of three, following documents are also mandatory:-
  • Xerox copy of Ration Card.
  • Xerox copies of Birth Certificate of members children.
  • Family members combined photograph(visiting card size)-2 copies

For one financial year, total amount of Rs 200/- (Rs. 100/- as Registration fee and Rs. 100/-as annual subscription ) is to be deposited as membership registration fee. After submitting all above mentioned required documents and depositing membership fees , Urban Poor Scheme Card gets handed over to concern citizen at PMC main building, 3rd floor room no. 333 ,Shivajinagar. If member lost his original card for the running financial year, duplicate card is issued to the member after depositing Rs 100/- .

Urban Poor card is valid for one financial year. Every Financial Year, citizens have to renew the membership .Members do not get benefits of Urban Poor Health Scheme, on previous years membership.
Urban Poor Health Scheme Card covers the following family members:-

  1. Members wife/husband
  2. Mother and Father of member
  3. Only first two children of member age less than 25 years.

But,if the third child of the member is born before 01/01/2005 , then his/her name gets enrolled in the Urban Poor Card. If any one got married before 25 years of his/her age, then his/her name gets canceled from Urban Poor Card. Citizens of Pune who could get the benefit from any other Government,Semi government /Health Insurance Company, can not get enrolled under Urban Poor Health Scheme of PMC Health Department.

Members of this Scheme, are supposed to take IPD health treatment from private hospitals which are enrolled on the panel of PMC Health Department. For IPD treatment in General Ward , 50% letter is issued from PMC health department, in the name of concern paneled private hospital, at PMC main building,3rd floor, Room no.340, Shivajinagar, and it gets handed over to patient .At the time of IPD admission of the concern patient, he/she is supposed to submit the original copy of 50% letter to private hospital. Once the Private Hospital receives the 50% letter along with xerox copy of Urban Poor Card, hospital billing department, takes only 50% amount of total IPD final bill from the concern patient. Remaining 50% amount of total final bill ,is to be paid by PMC ,Health Department, to the hospital, for the concern patient.
For one financial year and for one family, residing in PMC area, maximum amount of Rs.1,oo,ooo/-(In words – One Lacks only) is fixed for IPD treatments in paneled private hospitals. For health treatments exceeding the maximum limit of 1 lacks, concern patient is supposed to pay the exceeded amount to the concern private hospital.

Urban Poor Health Scheme, is applicable to only General Ward. Patients getting admitted in semi -private ,private or deluxe room can not get benefit of this scheme. Health services in paneled private hospitals are provided only as per C.G.H.S. rate schedule.

The members /patients of this scheme gets necessary treatment and required medicines totally free of cost from the Pune Municipal Corporation Dispensary. Name of the PMC dispensary , is written on Urban Poor Card.

View more details at - https://sgy.pmc.gov.in/
